Articles.Content:
Today I put down a lander on the Mun, in a Mun canyon. Bill got out, but fell a bit too far to the surface (no ladders - oops). I thought his final position was screenshot-worthy.

Wonder if there's other life out there...

"Damn, my moustache is sick."

9 out of 10 of my kerbals never fail to miss the ladder when getting out. I blame someone putting lube on the rungs(or door grips) as a practical joke.

And I totally see Bill being a moustache guy.

9 out of 10 of my kerbals never fail to miss the ladder when getting out.

mine do the same thing. it has got to the point where i don't really use ladders any more, unless it's for a higher gravity world where the jetpack won't work.

Bill looks pretty happy for someone who just fell off his spaceship.

My god it's full of stars!!

Hahaha yeah that's good

My god it's full of stars!!

This. Always this.

Today I put down a lander on the Mun, in a Mun canyon. Bill got out, but fell a bit too far to the surface (no ladders - oops). I thought his final position was screenshot-worthy.

Is the skybox reflection on his helmet stock? ive never noticed that before?

Is the skybox reflection on his helmet stock? ive never noticed that before?

I think that's part of the Astronomer's texture pack, for the Environmental Visual Enhancements mod.

I think that's part of the Astronomer's texture pack, for the Environmental Visual Enhancements mod.

Most of the gfx updates are from the KSPRC pack (Bill is a gentleman). There are some updates to the mods contained within that pack that I'm also using (smokescreen is one that comes to mind).
